description: In Nigeria, an American man is caught up in a dispute between the government and the crypto currency exchange Binance. Some lawmakers say that Nigeria is effectively holding him hostage.
title: Nigeria detains American Binance executive over dispute with the crypto company

description: Hurricane Debby is trundling across the Southeast, dropping massive amounts of rain. The storm formed over abnormally warm ocean water.
title: Hurricane Debby is dangerously rainy because it formed over abnormally warm water

description: The American-Swede made his eager fans wait until his final attempt at clinching a new world record at the Paris Olympics — knocking down his own by .01 meters.
title: Sweden's Mondo raises his own bar to set new Olympic and world record in pole vault

description: Growing despair in the West Bank is leading to a rise desire among young Palestinian men to die by fighting the Israeli occupation.
title: Despair in the West Bank is driving a desire among young men to die for a cause

description: This follows the weeks of protests over job quotas that saw clashes between protestors and ruling party supporters, and several instances of police brutality. The death toll from the crackdown ran into hundreds, and precipitated calls for Hasina’s resignation.
title: Photos: Bangladesh PM flees the country after weeks of deadly protests

description: Bangladesh's army chief says he'll form an interim government after the long-serving prime minister fled the country amid outrage over violent crackdowns against students.
title: A look at Bangladesh's new chapter

description: The U.S. has never won an Olympic medal in table tennis. But the interest of an NBA star has helped put a spotlight on the three-member women's team ahead of its first event Tuesday.
title: An NBA star helped put a spotlight on the U.S. women's table tennis team

description: As the U.S. men's basketball team prepared for Tuesday’s game against Brazil, NPR's Juana Summers talked the team’s managing director, Grant Hill, to ask how he views the competition.
title: How U.S. men's basketball is preparing for Olympics quarterfinals

description:
Iran has vowed to strike Israel following the assassination of a Hamas leader on Iran's soil. We hear from Israelis watching and waiting as they know an attack is coming but the don't know when.

And in the West Bank, the war between Israel and Hamas has sparked an increase in Palestinian men wanting to die fighting Israeli occupation.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Israel Waits for Retaliation From Iran; Some West Bank Men Want to Become Martyrs

description: Hurricane Debby made landfall Monday morning causing major power outages and flooding throughout the Florida, Georgia and South Carolina.
title: Hurricane Debby made landfall in southeast U.S., causing flooding and power outages

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with 18-year-old Olympic skateboarder Minna Stess about her journey in the sport.
title: Olympian Minna Stess talks about her skateboarding journey and her first Games

description: The U.S. and other governments issued Lebanon travel advisories and some airlines stopped flying there, in anticipation of an escalation of fighting after assassinations in Iran and Beirut.
title: War fears and flight cancellations in Lebanon send travelers and residents scrambling

description: Presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. admitted to dumping a dead bear cub in New York City’s Central Park and making it look like a bicyclist had hit the animal.
title: Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. admitted to dumping a dead bear cub in Central Park

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Gregory Daco, chief economist at Ernst and Young and about Monday's market sell off and what that could mean for the global economy.
title: What to make of this current market turmoil

description: Tyson Foods has been closing plants, sometimes driving chicken farmers out of business. Some farmers allege that the company put their life’s work in jeopardy in order to raise the price of chicken.
title: Farmers sue Tyson, saying it sacrificed their farms to raise the price of chicken

description: Israelis are steeling themselves for an attack from Iran and Hezbollah. Iran has vowed retaliation against Israel after the assassination of a Hamas leader in Tehran last week.
title: Israelis prepare for Iran attack

description: Imane Khelif and Lin Yu-Ting are guaranteed to leave Paris with medals. But fallout continues, as does drama between Olympic officials and the Russian-led association that disqualified them last year.
title: As an Olympic boxing controversy deepens, the women at its center are poised to medal

description: Jenna Ellis, a onetime attorney for former President Donald Trump, has agreed to a cooperation agreement with Arizona’s attorney general in the state official’s “fake electors” case.
title: Former Trump attorney agrees to cooperation agreement in Arizona 'fake elector' case

description: Vice President Harris is close to picking her running mate, and the stakes are high as the election between her and former President Donald Trump gets even closer. We look at the state of the race.
title: Kamala Harris is getting closer to picking a running mate

description: The highly anticipated decision comes nearly a year after the start of a trial pitting the U.S. Justice Department against Google in the country's biggest antitrust showdown in a quarter century.
title: Google loses massive antitrust case over its search dominance

description: The folk singer is set to play a rally for Vice President Harris and her yet-to-be-named running mate. They'll be in Wisconsin for a barnstorm tour of swing states.
title: She’s in his town: Bon Iver to perform at Harris rally in hometown of Eau Claire, Wis.

description: Missouri had argued that the rights of Missouri voters to hear from presidential candidates were being violated by the New York criminal proceeding.
title: Supreme Court rejects Missouri's bid to halt Trump’s sentencing in NY hush money case

description: You might be surprised to learn that "Grey's Anatomy" and recipes were on the Brazilian gymnast's mind on the eve of her gold medal winning routine in the Olympics floor event.
title: How 'Grey's Anatomy' and recipes psyched Rebeca Andrade up to best Simone Biles

description: In her first solo interview of the campaign, Usha Vance discussed how her family is adjusting to vice presidential campaign life and what she wants voters to know about her husband.
title: Usha Vance tries to defend her husband's "childless cat ladies" comment

description: Dr. Theodore Schwartz has been treating neurological illnesses for nearly 30 years. He says being a brain surgeon requires steady hands — and a strong bladder. His new book is Gray Matters.
title: For this brain surgeon, the operating room is 'the ultimate in mindful meditation'

description: The presidential candidate said he'd planned to take the roadkill home and skin it, but got waylaid by a long day of falconry and steak dinner. The mystery of the bear cub made national news in 2014.
title: RFK Jr. admits to dumping a dead bear in Central Park, solving a decade-old mystery

description: A study looks at the rate of self-managed abortion since Roe v. Wade fell. The study found that the use of mifepristone to self-manage abortion has nearly doubled from 6.6% in 2021 to 11.0% in 2023.
title: Abortion with no medical help? It nearly doubled in 2023, study shows

description: Stocks fell sharply across the globe on Monday, as worries about the U.S. economy triggered a worldwide sell-off.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average tumbled more than 1,000 points in early trading.
title: The Dow Jones plunges over 1,000 points  as markets are rocked by U.S. economy fears

description: Vice President Harris is expected to announce her running mate in the next few days. Her pick could help secure the presidential race. And, here's why the U.K. is rioting.
title: These states are Harris' path to presidency. And, why the U.K. is rioting

description: The announcement follows the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who had been in power for 15 years. Thousands of protesters had defied a military curfew and stormed her official residence.
title: Bangladesh’s army chief has announced the formation of an interim government

description: Monday's balance beam final saw Biles's first major mistake of these Olympic Games, a fall that cost her a podium spot. She has otherwise been transcendent in what may be her last Olympics ever.
title: Simone Biles misses a medal in Olympic balance beam final, Italy's D'Amato takes gold

description: The internet of animals, it's a global initiative to tag, track and learn about animal movement around the world.
title: A network dubbed the internet of animals is helping track migrating critters

description: The Middle East is bracing for tit-for-tat responses between Iran and Israel that could spin out into an all-out regional war.
title: Fears are growing of a widening war in the Middle East

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will be selecting her running mate soon. NPR's Michel Martin spoke with James Hamilton, who helped vet VP candidates for four democratic presidential candidates.
title: What the process looks like when it comes to vetting a presidential running mate

description: After the photo finish, Great Britain was initially awarded the silver. A review overturned that result, showing that the U.S. squeaked by to place second.
title: The U.S. wins silver in Olympic triathlon mixed relay after contesting close result

description: Debby is expected to move through Georgia and South Carolina after leaving Florida, according to the National Hurricane Center.
title: Hurricane Debby approaches Florida as it brings heavy rain across the Southeast

description: The National Hurricane Center says Debby is expected to bring hurricane force winds and a major flood threat to the southeastern United States.
title: Debby, a Category 1 hurricane, nears the Florida coast

description: American Noah Lyles won gold in the hundred meter sprint by five one thousandths of a second. U.S. swimmers grabbed two gold medals and shattered two world records in the pool.
title: The 2nd week of the Olympic Games in Paris started with athletes making history

description: A lot of people are sleep deprived, according to the CDC. Some take supplements like melatonin to help. Now there’s growing interest in magnesium as a sleep aid. But is there any evidence it works?
title: Americans don't get enough sleep. Can magnesium supplements help?

description: Trump’s leads in the Blue Wall states have been completely wiped out, and they remain true toss-ups. The former president retains a narrow lead in all four Sun Belt states.
title: Harris has momentum, but the race is still tight. Here are the paths to the presidency

description: With heat waves and extreme weather becoming more and more common, one Indiana teacher wants to empower her students with information, and the creative freedom to imagine big ideas.
title: In the face of global warming, students are dreaming up a better climate future

description: Frances Brissey says a car crash last year changed her life — in good ways and bad. But she feels grateful to have been saved by a passing truck driver.
title: She was severely injured in a crash. A truck driver became her 'highway angel'

description: We spoke with five people who have known Kamala Harris across different stages of her life, to find out what shaped her — and how she shapes others.
title: We spoke to 5 people who knew Kamala Harris before she was VP. Here's what we learned

description: A new study suggests fish may swim together in turbulent water to conserve energy.
title: Researchers have a new idea about why fish swim in schools.

description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Bangladeshi politics expert Ali Riaz, a professor at Illinois State, about protests in Bangladesh that led to score of deaths over the weekend.
title: Antigovernment protesters demand the prime minister of Bangladesh resign

description: Broadband internet and mobile data services were cut off across Bangladesh on Monday as anti-government protesters vowed to march to the capital to demand the prime minister's resignation.
title: Internet down in Bangladesh as protesters plan to march to capital

description: VP Harris is expected to announce her running mate within the next day. Fears grow of a widening war in the Middle East. The second week of the Olympic Games in Paris is off to a fast start.
title: Morning news brief

description: As a member of Congress, she passed a bill to hold the executive branch accountable for persistent violent crime in Native communities. Now she's a Cabinet secretary, but she's saying little about it.
title: Deb Haaland’s push to protect Indigenous people disappoints some Native leaders

description: Residents in Maui who lost their homes in the fire one year ago are just starting to rebuild. Should rebuilding be permitted on the ocean in the path of rising seas?
title: Post Maui fire: Should residents be allowed to rebuild in the path of rising water?

description: College and high school student leaders from across the country came together at a Chicago summit to discuss political issues, and promote constructive dialogue as a way to bridge polarizing divides.
title: Chicago summit promotes constructive dialogue as a way to bridge polarizing divides

description: Big names in fashion are outfitting Olympic teams at the Paris Games. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to "New York Times" critic Vanessa Friedman about how sports and fashion are more interrelated.
title: Big names in fashion are outfitting Olympic teams at the Paris Games

description: Far-right extremists have attacked mosques and hotels housing migrants in several of the U.K.'s most deprived cities. Unrest was fueled by misinformation online.
title: Misinformation online fueled all-out race riots in the United Kingdom
